title: Tours in Scotland 1677 & 1681. By T. Kirk and R. Thoresby. Edited by P. Hume Brown
author: Kirk, Thomas
snippet: 3 "Of Dalgety House, Seton's favourite residence, not so much as a stoneremains."—Ordnance Gazetteer (F. H. Groome).

title: Miscellaneous Prose Works of Sir Walter Scott, Bart
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: ing extensive estates in Lothian, and in the shiresof Perth, Aberdeen, Caithness, Stirling, Ayr, Dumfries, and Galloway, besides minor establishmentsin Clackmannan, Renfrew, Lanark, and Berwickshires. The females married into the Houses ofRothes, Seton, Gray, Olipliant, Stewart, and othersof the first rank; and one of their barons, as wehave seen, became nearly allied to the Crown. Inthe present day, exclusive of the Marquis of Bute,there can scarce be numbered three landed gentlemen of a family once so powerful; and even thevery name has become rare in the shires where itwas once most numerous.
